lcObjectivesGroup.lcObjective: Identify the best practices for adding images to a concept topic and the elements involved.
Add <fig> and <image> elements to the concept.
Identify the basic elements involved in adding tables to a concept topic.
Add a <simpletable> and <table> to the concept.

lcIntro.p: Images and tables give you a visual way to present or clarify information in your concept topic.
Using the <image> element on its own or inside a <fig> element, you can include images in your topic by reference.

With the <simpletable> and <table> elements, you can create tables to convey factual information in a clearer way than you can using body text. The <table> element is especially flexible in terms of structure.

This lesson shows how to add images and tables to a concept topic. Like the other elements introduced in this course, images and tables are not exclusive to the concept topic type and can also be used in the other DITA topic types (task, reference, and glossary).

note.p: This lesson covers basic use of these elements. For the full specifications for each element, see the OASIS DITA Version 1.2 Standard in the related information.
